hedline.hl1: Metro Business; WNBC-TV Anchor To Join Bloomberg

abstract.p: Dean Shepherd, who anchors WNBC-TV Live at Five evening news program, will leave station to join Bloomberg News as anchor of show Moneycast; Jim Rosenfield will replace him on Live at Five (S)

block.p: Dean Shepherd, the veteran journalist who is an anchor of WNBC-TV's ''Live at Five'' evening news program, will be leaving the station to join the Bloomberg News broadcast operation, according to officials at both companies. He will begin Oct. 1, the officials said.

Mr. Shepherd, who was also host of a weekly show on personal finance, started at WNBC in 1996 after seven years as a financial correspondent at CNBC, the cable financial news network of the station's corporate parent, NBC. He had been a correspondent for Money magazine, PBS and WCBS radio before becoming a television journalist.

Dean Shepherd, the veteran journalist who is an anchor of WNBC-TV's ''Live at Five'' evening news program, will be leaving the station to join the Bloomberg News broadcast operation, according to officials at both companies. He will begin Oct. 1, the officials said.

Mr. Shepherd, who was also host of a weekly show on personal finance, started at WNBC in 1996 after seven years as a financial correspondent at CNBC, the cable financial news network of the station's corporate parent, NBC. He had been a correspondent for Money magazine, PBS and WCBS radio before becoming a television journalist.
Mr. Shepherd will be anchor of Bloomberg's ''Moneycast,'' one of the most popular cable financial shows.
Anna Carbonell, a spokeswoman for WNBC, said that Jim Rosenfield, a reporter at the station, would replace Mr. Shepherd as one of the two anchors of ''Live at Five.''
